topic.title: Accessibility statement
topic.shortdesc: This website has been designed to meet the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (known as WCAG 2.1), an internationally recognised set of recommendations for improving web accessibility.

section.title: Accessibility statement for the NHS Data Model and Dictionary
section.p: NHS England is committed to making its websites accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.

section.title: Compliance statement
section.p: This website is compliant with Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.

section.title: Preparation of this accessibility statement
section.p: This statement was prepared on 25 August 2020.
This assessment was carried out by NHS Digital.

section.title: Feedback and contact information
section.p: Please contact information.standards@nhs.net or phone the Information Standards Service Desk on 0300 303 4777 to provide feedback or to request any further information about this statement.

section.title: Enforcement procedure
section.p: If you have a concern you wish to escalate, please contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS). They will then relay this to the Equality and Human Rights Commission.
